title: LG Odin 2.2GHz octa-core CPU ready for 2014 smartphones and tablets | Trusted Reviews
description: ![LG G2]()### Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to enable it](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-enable-alexa-whisper-mode-echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how toenable it")  * Samsung has already equipped one version of the Samsung Galaxy S4 with itsocta-core Exynos 5 processor, and other manufacturers will no doubt follow in2014.If LG does use its LG Odin chipset in future smartphones it would mark a moveaway from a reliance on third-party manufacturers.LG could save money and make more profit by manufacturing its own chips and itcertainly has the facilities to do so.It will have to be pretty powerful to compete with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 800and the Exynos equivalent, so we’ll be intrigued to see what the LG Odin cando next year.   **  Read more:[Best smartphones of 2013](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-smartphone_round-up).**   **  Via:** [P honeArena](http://www.phonearena.com/news/LG-Odin-2.2-GHz-octa-core-mobile-processor-prepped-for-G2-and-G-Pad-successors_id49594)
